Macros | Enumerations
Pulse Width Modulation (PWM)
Stratify OS » Device Interface

Detailed Description

This module controls the PWM peripherals on a microcontroller. More information about accessing peripheral IO is in the Device Interface section.

Macros

#define I_PWM_GETINFO
 Get the PWM attributes (pwm_attr_t)
 
#define I_PWM_SETATTR
 Set the PWM attributes (pwm_attr_t)
 
#define I_PWM_SETCHANNEL
 See details below. More...
 

Enumerations

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_PWM_SETCHANNEL

This IOCTL request sets the channel. The ctl argument is the channel to use. For example,

1 mcu_channel_t value;
2 value.channel = 0;
3 value.value = 100;
4 ioctl(pwm_fd, I_PWM_SET, &value); //write 100 to channel 0

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum pwm_flag_t
Enumerator
PWM_FLAG_SET_TIMER 

Set to configure the frequency and period (implies PWM_FLAG_SET_CHANNEL)

PWM_FLAG_IS_ACTIVE_HIGH 

Set to configure the outputs as active high

PWM_FLAG_IS_ACTIVE_LOW 

Set to configure the outputs as active low

PWM_FLAG_SET_CHANNELS 

Set to just configure channels and leave the timer alone

PWM_FLAG_CLEAR_CHANNELS 

Set to clear all channels; may be with with PWM_FLAG_SET_CHANNELS or PMW_FLAG_SET_TIMER

PWM_FLAG_IS_ENABLED 

Set with PMW_FLAG_SET_TIMER to enable the timer
